DISCLOSURE_INFO:
{
  "Allegations" : "ON AUGUST 8, 2011, THE CLIENTS REGISTERED A VERBAL COMPLAINT WITH ALLAN BUDELMAN CONCERNING THE PERFORMANCE OF THEIR ACCOUNTS FOR THE PERIOD SINCE THEIR REVIEW MEETING WITH MR. BUDELMAN ON JUNE 14.  DURING THE REVIEW MEETING, THE CLIENTS HAD REQUESTED TO HAVE THEIR ACCOUNTS POSITIONED SUCH THAT THEY WERE NEUTRAL VERSUS THE STOCK MARKET.  WHEN THEY RECEIVED A PERFORMANCE UPDATE, THEY WERE UNHAPPY WITH THEIR PORTFOLIO'S PERFORMANCE RELATIVE TO THE STOCK MARKET.THEY BELIEVED INADEQUATE ACTION WAS TAKEN TO IMPLEMENT A MARKET NEUTRAL STRATEGY IN THEIR ACCOUNTS. MR. BUDELMAN HAD REDUCED THE PORTFOLIOS EXPOSURE TO THE STOCK MARKET POST REVIEW; HOWEVER, THE CLIENT'S EXPECTATION WAS THAT THEY WOULD HAVE NO LOSSES IN CASE OF A MARKET DOWNTURN. MR. BUDELMAN, IN LIGHT OF THE CLIENT'S WISH TO REMAIN INVESTED (I.E., NOT TO GO TO CASH), FELT THAT THE RELATIVE PERFORMANCE WAS ACCEPTABLE. DUE TO LACK OF CLARITY REGARDING THE CLIENT'S MANDATE, THE FIRM FELT A MISCOMMUNICATION TOOK PLACE. IN VIEW OF THE LONG-STANDING CLIENT RELATIONSHIP, THE FIRM SETTLED WITH THE CLIENT FOR $28,000 IN CASH PAYMENTS AND FIVE QUARTERS OF WAIVED MANAGEMENT FEES (APPRX. $25,000).",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$100,000.00",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$53,000.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "This complaint Disclosure was originally filed in error.  [customer] has signed an affidavit stating that the disclosure event that occurred on 08/08/2011 with Allan Budelman at Emerald Asset Advisors was a misunderstanding between Allan and [customer].  [customer] never intended for it to be a formal complaint rather a discussion concerning the positioning of his portfolio.  [customer] continues to maintain his relationship with Allan and Emerald."
